key_points: Gabby Petito was remembered as a 'super kind-hearted, sweet girl' by the owner of a surf shop in her Long Island hometown.
The surf shop owner, who remained anonymous, said Petito was a longtime customer who was always smiling.
Petito's remains were found in Wyoming's Teton-Bridger National Forest, with her death ruled as a homicide by the Teton County Coroner.
Petito went missing while on a cross-country trip with her fiancé, Brian Laundrie.
Gabby Petito and Brian Laundrie started their road trip in June, traveling from Florida to New York and then towards western national parks.
Petito visited the surf shop before leaving Long Island in early July, buying a shirt for Laundrie.
Laundrie returned to Florida on September 1 without Petito and has been named a person of interest in her disappearance.
Petito's white van was seized from Laundrie's family home on September 11.
Friends and family of Petito describe her as creative, artistic, and someone who wanted to live life to the fullest.
Authorities are searching for Laundrie in a Florida nature reserve and other locations.
